Summary: VTO is looking to bring a technology manager to be part of VTO's Batteries team. Technology managers support the research, development, and demonstration of high-impact technologies and solutions that enable the reliable, resilient, secure, and cost-effective integration of sustainable transportation on our nation's roads. This position is supported by the Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill (BIL) and is focused on battery and critical mineral recycling.

VTO is looking to bring a technology manager to be part of VTO's Batteries team. Technology managers support the research, development, and demonstration of high-impact technologies and solutions that enable the reliable, resilient, secure, and cost-effective integration of sustainable transportation on our nation's roads. This position is supported by the Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill (BIL) and is focused on electric drive vehicle battery recycling and second-life applications.

VTO is looking to bring a technology manager to be part of VTO's Analysis team. Technology managers support the research, development, and demonstration of high-impact technologies and solutions that enable the reliable, resilient, secure, and cost-effective integration of sustainable transportation on our nation's roads. At the GS-13 level, analysis technology development managers serve as technical experts in state-of-the-art vehicle and related energy technologies development; vehicle fuel economy and performance; sustainable transportation technology readiness assessment and forecasting; vehicle technology cost reduction; vehicle choice, consumer behavior, and market penetration and dynamics modeling; greenhouse gas accounting and reduction strategies; and other related technologies.

VTO is looking for a dynamic, innovative leader to manage the Vehicle Technologies Office's Energy Efficient Mobility Systems (EEMS) Program. Program managers direct the research, development, and demonstration of high-impact technologies and solutions that enable the reliable, resilient, secure, and cost-effective integration of sustainable transportation on our nation's roads. The EEMS program manager manages a team of technical experts in in modeling and simulation; high-performance computing-enabled data analytics; new and emerging transportation-system technologies and new mobility solutions; connected, shared, and automated vehicles; and other related technologies.

VTO is looking to bring a technology manager to be part of VTO's Batteries team. Technology development managers support the research, development, and demonstration of high-impact technologies and solutions that enable the reliable, resilient, secure, and cost-effective integration of sustainable transportation on our nation's roads. At the GS-13 level, technology development managers serve as technical experts in battery chemistry and cell technologies, supply chains, and recycling.

VTO is looking to bring a technology manager to be part of VTO's Batteries team. Technology development managers support the research, development, and demonstration of high-impact technologies and solutions that enable the reliable, resilient, secure, and cost-effective integration of sustainable transportation on our nation's roads. At the GS-12 level, technology development managers serve as junior technical experts in battery chemistry and cell technologies, supply chains, and recycling.

VTO is looking to bring a technology manager to be part of VTO's Electrification team. Technology managers support the research, development, and demonstration of high-impact technologies and solutions that enable the reliable, resilient, secure, and cost-effective integration of sustainable transportation on our nation's roads. At the GS-13 level, technology development managers serve as technical experts in electric-drive systems , powertrain and vehicle charging technologies, vehicle-grid integration, and other related technologies.

VTO is looking to bring a technology manager to be part of VTO's Off-road, Rail, Marine and Aviation R&D team. Technology managers support the research, development, and demonstration of high-impact technologies and solutions that enable the reliable, resilient, secure, and cost-effective integration of sustainable transportation on our nation's roads. At the GS-13 level, technology development managers serve as technical experts in difficult to electrify sectors (off-road, rail, and marine); renewable fuels, such as advanced biofuels, renewable hydrogen, and e-fuels; heavy duty truck technologies, including the integration of hybrid and plug-in hybrid powertrains; catalysis research to cost-effectively reduce emissions from non-road engines, while reducing/replacing critical minerals, i.e., platinum group metals; and other related technologies.

VTO is looking to bring a technology manager to be part of VTO's Energy Efficient Mobility Systems (EEMS) team. Technology managers support the research, development, and demonstration of high-impact technologies and solutions that enable the reliable, resilient, secure, and cost-effective integration of sustainable transportation on our nation's roads. At the GS-13 level, technology development managers serve as technical experts in modeling and simulation; high-performance computing-enabled data analytics; new and emerging transportation-system technologies and new mobility solutions; connected, shared, and automated vehicles; and other related technologies.

This position is part of the Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy - Headquarters, Department of Energy. As a Energy Technology Program Specialist, you will be developing effective federal/state approaches to deploying clean energy technologies for all sectors of the economy.

DOE's Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy Office is looking for a dynamic, innovative, seasoned executive to lead the Vehicle Technologies Office, a $400M research, development, demonstration & deployment (RDD&D) organization. You'll develop research strategies, demonstration & deployment initiatives; and lead execution of programs with public, private-sector & national labs to achieve cost-effective national energy, environment and economic goals through sustainable transportation solutions.
